article.headline: Central Michigan 68, Valparaiso 55
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- Kevin Nelson scored 16 points and was 9-of-10 from the foul line to lead Central Michigan past Valparaiso 68-55 on Tuesday night. The Chippewas (1-1) ran out to a 12-0 first-half lead and the Crusaders didn't score their first points until the 16:53 mark when Dan Oppland connected on two free throws. Valparaiso's first basket came two minutes later when Moussa Mbaye scored on a putback. Valparaiso (0-2) hit just five field goals in the first half and shot 25 percent from the field. The Crusaders cut the lead to just five points, 45-40, with 10:36 remaining in the game on a lay-up by Ron Howard, but the Chippewas hit their free throws down the stretch. Central Michigan was 18-of-20 from the line, including Nelson's 7-of-8 shooting in the final 10 minutes. The Chippewas' defense hounded the Crusaders into 20 turnovers, including eight by senior guard Ali Berdiel. Tony Bowne added 15 points for Central Michigan while freshman guard Giordan Watson scored 13 and had four assists and four steals. Howard led the Crusaders with 12 points before fouling out with just more than eight minutes to go in the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
